That's what i've searched for handling files and disk space, i got tired of writing in the command line all the time and looked for something simple and easy to use.. 
Perfect for beginners who are not sure how to handle disk space in ubuntu

Indexes all mounted partitions in all HDDs you have, either ext4 or ntfs and has an expanded tree view that allows you to easily spot those big files that are eating up disk space so you can decide if you can move them else where! It even has the ability to open file explorer just by right-clicking on the coloured folder or file in the tree view!
summary: A must have visual disk space manager!
